reviews.review_msg: Tracy was very approachable and answered all of my questions kindly. The exams were super hard and took forever to write (only time I have ever run out of time). Her and the TA were both away quite a bit throughout the semester making it difficult to ask questions outside of class time and get marks back in a timely manner.

Very knowledgeable and great at teaching. Strict and late marker, we received our midterm marks only a week prior to the exam and the field report marks were released 1 week after the course had wrapped up, leaving no room for feedback. Tracy is very hard to approach, specially if you are a guy, and makes talking to her extremely difficult.

If you took 213 with her or her grad students, the format of the lectures and midterm is quite similar. The only thing is I felt out of place in class, because she would talk really fast and there was a lot of info to grasp. A lot fo people ran out of time for the midterm too so it didn't go very well. The labs are a bit better though.

Tracy is a very good teacher, do not listen to comments about how she is hard to follow. People who wrote these probably aren't very bright because her slides are easy to follow. The only criticism I have is Tracy is very hard to talk to and ask questions to, or maybe it's just how I interpreted her answer.   Tracy expects you to give it 100%.

Condescending at times, shot guns a ton of information at you during lecture. Over load of information makes it difficult for the average student to intake information, interpret, and fully understand the material.
Extremely unhelpful and unfriendly

This lady is a bit intense but very schooled. Her lectures are very informative. There are no surprises when it comes to the exams, but there is A LOT to know. Labs were decent. The field trip was rad. Generally a good course/prof.

Once again a fun field trip. It's amazing that someone can be this knowledgeable and excited about glaciers! She marks the reports fairly hard. The final exam is comprehensive and you need to know your details!

Hard midterm and final. Lecture is very informative but you will feel being overloaded after each lecture. Field trip is fun but again the grading is tough. Received B- at the end (My upper year GPA is 3.8 before and 3.5 after this class)

A few too many "mandatory" interesting readings that should have been optional (because unnecessary for understanding and not on exams).  And the math was optional, too.  Not required on exams and not done in depth anyway.  Other than that, excellent course.

Great professor! Super interested in her subject, and very knowledgable. She is extremely approachable. However, she is also equally demanding, and the marking scheme is quite rigid. Know your stuff, and know it well! Details and all.
Motor mouth...she knows her stuff, but she spits out too much info to digest. hard exams.

Knows what she is talking about, fairly strong lecturer. Be prepared to really work hard to succeed; the laboratories are alot of map analysis/hunting through lecture notes/textbook and the tests are EXTREMELY demanding.
great prof, talks really fast though and seems uneasy when talking to undergrads one on one. Very nice lady and tests are fair and straighforward

Very hard teacher that really knows what she is talking about.  Tests were super hard, especially the math aspect of it.  I didn't find that she was really willing to help you out when you had a problem with understanding math.  GREAT FIELDTRIP TP MERRITT.  She had a great time there.
Very professional. Extremely well prepared. Excelent lecture lab coordination. Expect to work really hard. This felt like a university course not a basket weaver.
tests were soooo hard... i failed the class even though i had a 95% average on labs, and assignments! Do not recommend this prof AT ALL.
Hard but fair.
The material are quite challenging, but her notes are easy to follow and understand.  No need to study the textbook.  Her midterm is easy, but her final exam is a different story.
Very clear, very helpful and knows a lot and wants to pass that on.  Brilliant prof who does tend to favour the gals over the guys a tad although not as much as she used to.
overall course is OK, MT and final is a killer.
Clear expectations, hard for dumb arts students. Puts a huge amount of prepartation into her teaching and expects the same commitment from you. Course content is very useful and up to date.
You may not like her, but there are few professors that outline as clearly what she expects of you and then helps you learn it.
If you have a Y chromosome, find a different class to take. If you don't, you'd better be great at memorization.
A great professor who is passionate about the subject area.  Workload is demanding but the benefits upon completing the course outweigh the short-term stress.
Very clear on expectations-very fun on field trips!!
Course is demanding but fair.  TA Chris is great.
she's great; just do your work!!
Personally: very friendly.  Professionally: tough (may appear as unfriendly)
Inapprochable and unhelpful. She favours few students.
Really high on herself, doesn't like students.
